Q: What is the name of Ishmael’s close companion aboard the Pequod?
A:
Queequeg

Metrics.R: The score is 0.38 because only a small portion of the retrieval directly answers the question — e.g., "First of all was Queequeg.", "Queequeg, whom Starbuck, the chief mate, had selected.", and "The Pequod was the identical ship that Yojo had provided to carry Queequeg and me round the Cape." — while most extracted lines are irrelevant, such as "there generally subsists between the two, a close intimacy and friendliness" (describes a relationship, not a name), "we set down who the Pequod’s harpooneers were, and to what headsman each of them belonged" (about harpooneers), "Killed more whales than I can count, Captain Peleg.", "Well, bring him along then.", and "After signing the papers, off I went; nothing doubting but that I had done a good morning’s work." (all unrelated to identifying Ishmael’s companion).
